title: Phagocytosis
summary: Phagocytosis (from Ancient Greek  φαγεῖν (phagein)  'to eat', and  κύτος, (kytos)  'cell') is the process by which a cell uses its plasma membrane to engulf a large particle (≥ 0.5 μm), giving rise to an internal compartment called the phagosome.  It is one type of endocytosis. A cell that performs phagocytosis is called a phagocyte.
